snippet: Hostages who escaped or were freed described gunshots ringing out during breakfast, followed by foreigners being separated from Algerians.
abstract: Hundreds of workers who escaped hostage situation at gas field in eastern Algeria describe the ordeal in chilling detail; stories suggest that attack had been planned long before French military began its offensive in Mali, event that militants claimed as their primary motivation.

byline.original: By LYDIA POLGREEN and SCOTT SAYARE
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter contributed reporting from Bamako, Mali; Douglas Dalby from Dublin; and Manny Fernandez from Houston.

lead_paragraph: Hostages who escaped or were freed described gunshots ringing out during breakfast, followed by foreigners being separated from Algerians.
